title: Update Soundpad button visuals to reflect their corresponding sounds

requirements.summary: Update each button in the SoundpadPage so that its visual design — including icon, accent color, label style, and/or button shape — reflects the character and feel of its corresponding sound while retaining the existing press/active animation and overall neon arcade theme
acceptanceCriteria: Every button on SoundpadPage has a distinct accent color that matches the mood/feel of its sound (e.g., bright red for Airhorn, sickly green for Fart, deep purple for Evil Laugh).
Each button displays a small thematic icon or emoji that visually represents its sound.
No two buttons share the same color + icon combination.
The existing press/active state animation is preserved on all buttons.
The page retains the dark neon arcade theme (near-black background, Chakra Petch or Exo 2 typography, neon glow effects).
The '67' button has a visually distinct style consistent with its neon orange/cyan accent established in the previous feature.
All 16+ sound buttons remain functional and trigger their corresponding Web Audio API sound on click.

file_operations.description: Update each sound button to have a distinct visual identity reflecting its sound character. Add unique accent colors for each button (e.g., bright red/orange for Airhorn, sickly green for Fart, muted yellow/brown for Sad Trombone, muted green for Crickets, deep purple for Evil Laugh, neon orange for '67'). Add thematic icons or emojis to each button that visually represent the sound (e.g., megaphone for Airhorn, cloud/puff for Fart, music note for Sad Trombone, bug for Crickets, skull for Evil Laugh). Ensure each button maintains its existing press/active state animation. Preserve the dark neon arcade theme with Chakra Petch or Exo 2 typography and ensure the '67' button retains its distinctive neon orange/cyan styling. Keep all buttons fully functional with their Web Audio API sound triggers.
